DataElement.preferredName: Patient Additional Malignancy Diagnosis Or Receive Therapeutic Procedure Prior Enrollment And Residual Disease Evidence Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine study eligibility as to whether the patient has been diagnosed with another cancer or treated for another cancer prior to registration and has evidence of residual disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Additional Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis Or Receive Therapeutic Procedure Prior Enrollment And Residual Disease or Disorder Evidence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Added; extra; further._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses._To take, accept, or get something offered._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Earlier in time or order._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition._Remaining or left behind._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Knowledge on which to base belief._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Additional Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis Or Receive Therapeutic Procedure Prior Enrollment And Residual Disease or Disorder Evidence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Remaining or left behind.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Knowledge on which to base belief.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Added; extra; further.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Earlier in time or order.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Remaining or left behind.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient been diagnosed or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed or treated for another malignancy within 2 years before study enrollment or previously diagnosed with another malignancy and has evidence of residual disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed or treated for another malignancy within 2 years before randomization or previously diagnosed with another malignancy and has evidence of residual disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another invasive malignancy within 3 years before the first dose of study drug, or any evidence of residual disease from a previously diagnosed malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another active malignancy within 2 years prior to screening, with the exception of malignancies with a negligible risk of metastasis or death (e.g., 5-year OS rate 90%), such as adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, ductal carcinoma in situ, Stage I uterine cancer, non-melanoma skin cancer, resected in situ cancer, or definitively treated low risk prostate cancer?
